author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...EXTREMELY DANGEROUS BERYL ENTERS THE SOUTHEASTERN CARIBBEAN... ...LIFE-THREATENING WINDS AND DANGEROUS STORM SURGE CONDITIONS  CONTINUE OVER THE SOUTHERN WINDWARD ISLANDS...
summary:
...EXTREMELY DANGEROUS BERYL ENTERS THE SOUTHEASTERN CARIBBEAN... ...LIFE-THREATENING WINDS AND DANGEROUS STORM SURGE CONDITIONS  CONTINUE OVER THE SOUTHERN WINDWARD ISLANDS...
 As of 2:00 PM AST Mon Jul 1
 the center of Beryl was located near 12.8, -62.3
 with movement WNW at 20 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 946 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 150 mph.
